intro: Anisotomaria, commonly known as the glassy fanflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Scrophulariaceae. These plants are native to South Africa and are characterized by their distinctive, fan-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The leaves are usually opposite and have a waxy, glassy appearance, which gives the plant its common name. Anisotomaria species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in drought conditions.
